issue.body:
---
title: "ðŸš€ Epic: Advanced Features Development Roadmap - Analytics & Verification Enhancements"
labels: "epic, enhancement, analytics, validation, P2: Medium"
---

### ðŸŽ¯ **Overarching Goal: Drive Innovation and Enhance Data-Driven Insights Across the CV System**

This epic serves as a strategic roadmap for implementing advanced features that enhance the analytical capabilities, data verification processes, and overall user experience of the AI-Enhanced CV System. It consolidates and tracks the progress of several key initiatives aimed at delivering a more intelligent, reliable, and performant platform.

### **Key Feature Areas & Related Issues**

This epic is composed of, and tracks progress across, the following interconnected feature development areas:

#### 1. **Enhanced Analytics Dashboards**

-   **Objective**: Provide real-time, comprehensive insights into various aspects of the CV system, including quality, development activity, and user engagement.
-   **Contributing Issues**:
    -   #242 (Quality Automation Dashboard - Real-Time Monitoring & Analytics Platform)
    -   #99 (Create 'Watch Me Work' Live Activity Dashboard)
    -   #158 (Workflow Artifact Dashboards - Rich CI Reporting & Visualization)
    -   #147 (Advanced Analytics Enhancements - AI-Powered Insights & Predictive Modeling)

#### 2. **Robust Verification & Content Authenticity**

-   **Objective**: Strengthen the system's ability to verify information, prevent AI hallucinations, and ensure the authenticity of career progression and claims.
-   **Contributing Issues**:
    -   #212 (Historical CV Archive Integration - AI Hallucination Protection Through Career Progression Validation)
    -   #91 (Implement Advanced AI Verification Techniques)
    -   #90 (Integrate Claude Citations API for Verifiable Claims)
    -   #29 (Implement deep, multifaceted, context-aware review of AI-generated content)

#### 3. **Optimized User Experience & Performance**

-   **Objective**: Deliver a seamless, highly responsive, and accessible experience across all devices and platforms.
-   **Contributing Issues**:
    -   #209 (Mobile Responsive Dashboard Optimization)
    -   #241 (Core Web Vitals Excellence - Advanced Performance Optimization Initiative)
    -   #240 (Progressive Web App Standards Implementation - Next-Generation Professional CV Platform)
    -   #38 (Implement Sophisticated Dark Mode with Neurotype-Aware Design System)
    -   #39 (Implement Advanced Micro-Interactions & Animation Excellence)

#### 4. **Strategic Infrastructure & AI Integration**

-   **Objective**: Modernize core infrastructure and optimize AI integration for efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and advanced capabilities.
-   **Contributing Issues**:
    -   #203 (AI Router Production Deployment - OAuth Cost Optimization Phase 2)
    -   #201 (Cost Router Integration - Unified Authentication & Budget Management)
    -   #95 (Implement Chain-of-Thought (CoT) for Complex AI Reasoning)
    -   #94 (Adopt "Tool Use" Paradigm for Structured JSON Output)

### **Acceptance Criteria (for the Epic)**

-   [ ] All contributing issues listed under this epic are closed and verified.
-   [ ] The dashboards provide comprehensive, real-time analytics with actionable insights.
-   [ ] The system demonstrates robust content verification and hallucination protection.
-   [ ] The user experience is optimized for mobile, performance, and accessibility.
-   [ ] AI integration is efficient, cost-effective, and leverages advanced reasoning capabilities.
-   [ ] The `DEVELOPMENT_INTELLIGENCE_DASHBOARD.md` and other relevant documentation are updated to reflect the new features and capabilities.

### **Strategic Value**

This epic is crucial for:

-   **Technical Leadership**: Showcasing advanced capabilities in AI, data analytics, and web development.
-   **Professional Credibility**: Enhancing the system's ability to provide verifiable and authentic career insights.
-   **User Engagement**: Delivering a superior and more intelligent user experience.
-   **Competitive Advantage**: Positioning the CV system as a cutting-edge, data-driven professional platform.

---

**Priority**: P2 Medium - Strategic roadmap for continuous innovation.
**Estimated Effort**: Ongoing - This is a continuous development epic.
**Business Value**: High - Drives innovation, enhances insights, and improves user experience.

issue.body:
---
title: "ðŸ§ª Enterprise Testing Framework Reliability Enhancement"
labels: "enhancement, reliability, testing, P1: High"
---

### ðŸŽ¯ **Goal: Achieve >95% Test Pass Rate and Eliminate Flaky Tests**

This initiative aims to significantly enhance the reliability and stability of our Enterprise Testing Framework. The current ~71% test success rate is below enterprise standards and undermines confidence in our quality assurance processes. Achieving a consistent >95% pass rate and eliminating flaky tests is critical for maintaining development velocity and ensuring production readiness.

### **Current Testing Status Analysis**

Our comprehensive testing suite, as outlined in `tests/README.md`, covers various aspects including Accessibility, Performance, Mobile, Cross-Browser, Dashboard, and Theme validation. However, several suites are exhibiting reliability issues:

-   **Cross-browser compatibility tests**: Intermittent browser launch failures.
-   **Performance testing**: Lighthouse score variations causing false failures.
-   **Mobile responsiveness tests**: Viewport simulation inconsistencies.
-   **Dashboard analytics tests**: Data loading race conditions.
-   **Export functionality tests**: PDF generation timeout issues.

### **Reliability Enhancement Objectives**

-   **Target Success Rate**: Consistently achieve >95% test pass rate across all test suites.
-   **Flaky Test Elimination**: Identify and resolve root causes of intermittent test failures.
-   **Robust Error Handling**: Implement comprehensive error recovery and clear reporting.
-   **Performance Consistency**: Ensure stable test execution times across different environments.

### **Technical Enhancement Plan**

We will systematically address the identified reliability issues through a phased approach:

#### 1. **Test Stabilization (Phase 1)**

-   **Cross-Browser Test Fixes**: Implement robust retry logic for browser launches (e.g., Playwright `launch` options with retries) and ensure consistent browser environment setup.
-   **Performance Test Reliability**: Refine Lighthouse testing by implementing multiple-sample averaging and defining more tolerant, yet still high-standard, thresholds in `tests/performance/lighthouse.config.js`. Investigate and stabilize the test server (`jest-puppeteer.config.js` `server` option) to prevent connection issues.
-   **Mobile Responsiveness Test Consistency**: Standardize viewport management and device emulation within `mobile/responsive-design.test.js` to eliminate simulation inconsistencies.

#### 2. **Error Handling Enhancement (Phase 2)**

-   **Comprehensive Error Recovery**: Implement intelligent retry mechanisms (e.g., `executeTestWithRetry` as proposed in the original issue) for tests prone to transient failures.
-   **Improved Assertions**: Enhance test assertions to provide more precise failure diagnostics, clearly distinguishing between application bugs and test environment flakiness.
-   **Dynamic Timeout Management**: Implement adaptive timeouts based on test type and complexity, as outlined in the original issue, to prevent premature test failures.

#### 3. **Test Suite Optimization (Phase 3)**

-   **Dashboard Analytics Test Stabilization**: Address data loading race conditions in `dashboard/career-intelligence.test.js` by implementing explicit wait conditions for data availability (e.g., `page.waitForSelector`, `page.waitForFunction`).
-   **Export Functionality Test Reliability**: Increase timeouts and implement progress monitoring for PDF generation tests to account for varying processing times.
-   **Reporting Enhancement**: Improve test reports to clearly highlight flaky tests and provide actionable recommendations for their resolution.

### **Acceptance Criteria**

-   [ ] The overall test pass rate consistently exceeds 95% in CI/CD pipelines.
-   [ ] No flaky tests are observed in the production test suite over a two-week period.
-   [ ] Test reports provide clear, actionable diagnostics for any failures.
-   [ ] Cross-browser compatibility tests pass consistently across all targeted browsers (Chromium, Firefox, WebKit).
-   [ ] Performance tests yield stable and consistent results within defined thresholds.
-   [ ] Mobile responsiveness tests accurately reflect expected behavior across various device viewports.
-   [ ] Dashboard analytics and export functionality tests pass reliably.
-   [ ] The `tests/README.md` is updated to reflect the enhanced reliability and any new test execution patterns.

### **Implementation Timeline**

1.  **Week 1: Test Stabilization**: Focus on Cross-Browser, Performance, and Mobile test fixes.
2.  **Week 2: Error Handling & Dashboard/Export**: Implement comprehensive error recovery and stabilize Dashboard/Export tests.
3.  **Week 3: Optimization & Reporting**: Refine dynamic timeouts, enhance reporting, and eliminate remaining flakiness.

---

**Priority**: P1 High - Critical for development confidence and professional quality assurance.
**Estimated Effort**: 105 minutes total (Comprehensive test suite enhancement).
**Business Value**: High - Ensures reliable quality gates, faster feedback loops, and confident deployments.

comment.body:
### âœ… **Issue Groomed: Enterprise Testing Framework Reliability Enhancement**

I have groomed this issue to provide a clear, actionable plan for enhancing the reliability of our testing framework. The original issue identified the problem, and this groomed version refines the implementation strategy and emphasizes specific, measurable outcomes.

**Key Changes:**

-   **Clearer Objectives**: Explicitly states the goal of achieving a >95% test pass rate and eliminating flaky tests.
-   **Systematic Approach**: Outlines a phased approach to address specific failing test categories (Cross-browser, Performance, Mobile, Dashboard, Export).
-   **Actionable Techniques**: Provides concrete techniques for test stabilization, error handling, and test suite optimization.
-   **Measurable Acceptance Criteria**: Defines specific, verifiable outcomes for each aspect of reliability enhancement.

This groomed issue provides a precise roadmap for building a bulletproof testing framework, ensuring higher confidence in our deployments and faster feedback loops for development.

issue.body:
---
title: "ðŸ“± P2 MEDIUM: Mobile Responsive Dashboard Optimization"
labels: "enhancement, frontend, visualization, P2: Medium, ux, mobile"
---

### ðŸŽ¯ **Goal: Deliver a Premium Mobile Experience for All Dashboards**

This initiative aims to transform the mobile experience of our existing dashboards (`Development Intelligence Dashboard`, `Watch Me Work Dashboard`, and `Career Intelligence Dashboard`) into a premium, touch-optimized, and highly performant interface. The goal is to meet and exceed Fortune 500 mobile experience expectations, enhancing accessibility and demonstrating cutting-edge UX standards.

### **Current Mobile Experience Assessment**

While basic responsiveness is implemented, advanced mobile optimization is needed across all dashboard interfaces. Key areas for enhancement include:

-   **Touch Interface Optimization**: Current interactions may not be fully touch-friendly, lacking optimal button sizing and gesture support.
-   **Performance**: Mobile loading and rendering strategies can be further optimized for faster and smoother experiences.
-   **Navigation**: Mobile navigation patterns may not be intuitive or fully optimized for smaller screens.
-   **Content Layout**: Mobile-first design principles need to be rigorously applied to ensure optimal content presentation on various devices.

### **Proposed Technical Enhancement Plan**

We will focus on comprehensive mobile optimization across all dashboard interfaces, leveraging existing structures and applying modern web development best practices.

#### 1. **Touch Interface Optimization**

-   **Gesture-Friendly Interactions**: Implement swipe navigation for content carousels or tabbed sections where applicable.
-   **Optimal Touch Targets**: Ensure all interactive elements (buttons, links, cards) meet a minimum touch target size of 44px x 44px.
-   **Haptic Feedback**: Explore subtle haptic feedback for key interactions on supported devices to enhance user engagement.

#### 2. **Mobile Performance Optimization**

-   **Mobile-First Loading Strategy**: Implement progressive enhancement, lazy-loading non-critical assets (e.g., charts, large images) on mobile devices.
-   **Resource Prioritization**: Optimize the loading order of critical resources to improve First Contentful Paint (FCP) and Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) on mobile networks.
-   **Animation Refinement**: Ensure animations are smooth (60fps) and performant on mobile devices, avoiding layout-triggering properties.

#### 3. **Mobile-First Design Implementation**

-   **Responsive Layout Enhancement**: Apply advanced CSS techniques (e.g., Flexbox, Grid, `clamp()` for typography) to create truly adaptive layouts that fluidly adjust to different screen sizes.
-   **Mobile-Optimized Typography**: Adjust font sizes, line heights, and letter spacing for optimal readability on mobile screens.
-   **Intuitive Mobile Navigation**: Implement patterns like off-canvas menus, bottom navigation bars, or tabbed interfaces for easy access to dashboard sections.

### **Specific Dashboard Enhancements**

-   **Career Intelligence Dashboard**: Optimize Chart.js configurations for mobile, ensuring legends and tooltips are mobile-friendly.
-   **Watch Me Work Dashboard**: Refine activity card layouts and progress indicators for touch interaction and smaller screens.
-   **Development Intelligence Dashboard**: Implement progressive disclosure for complex features, hiding advanced analytics behind expandable sections on mobile to reduce cognitive load.

### **Mobile UX Excellence Standards**

-   **Touch Interface Guidelines**: Adhere to industry standards for touch targets and gesture support.
-   **Performance Standards**: Target sub-3-second loading times on mobile networks, with smooth 60fps animations.
-   **Accessibility Standards**: Ensure WCAG 2.1 AA compliance, including screen reader optimization and high contrast modes for mobile.

### **Acceptance Criteria**

-   [ ] All interactive elements on the dashboards are touch-friendly and meet the 44px minimum touch target size.
-   [ ] Dashboards load within 3 seconds on simulated mobile network conditions (e.g., Fast 3G in Lighthouse).
-   [ ] Mobile navigation patterns are intuitive and allow seamless access to all dashboard features.
-   [ ] Content layouts adapt fluidly to various mobile screen sizes, maintaining readability and usability.
-   [ ] The dashboards achieve a Lighthouse Accessibility score of 90+ on mobile.
-   [ ] The `DevelopmentIntelligenceDashboard.js`, `watch-me-work.js`, `career-intelligence.js` (and their associated CSS/HTML) are updated to reflect these optimizations.
-   [ ] The `DEVELOPMENT_INTELLIGENCE_DASHBOARD.md` documentation is updated to reflect the enhanced mobile experience.

### **Implementation Timeline**

1.  **Week 1: Foundation & Touch Optimization**: Implement core responsive design improvements and touch-friendly interactions.
2.  **Week 2: Performance & Navigation**: Focus on mobile performance optimizations and intuitive mobile navigation patterns.
3.  **Week 3: Polish & Accessibility**: Refine animations, enhance accessibility, and conduct cross-device testing.

---

**Priority**: P2 Medium - Essential for enhancing user experience and demonstrating modern frontend expertise.
**Estimated Effort**: 105 minutes total (Comprehensive mobile optimization).
**Business Value**: High - Increases user engagement, broadens accessibility, and showcases technical leadership.

comment.body:

I have groomed this issue to provide a clear, actionable plan for enhancing the mobile experience of our dashboards. The original issue was comprehensive, and this groomed version refines the implementation strategy and emphasizes specific, measurable outcomes.

**Key Changes:**

---
title: "âš¡ **ENHANCEMENT**: Core Web Vitals Excellence - Advanced Performance Optimization Initiative"
labels: "enhancement, validation, monitoring, P1: High, performance"
---

### ðŸŽ¯ **Goal: Achieve and Maintain Google 'Good' Core Web Vitals Scores**

This initiative aims to optimize the CV website to consistently achieve 'Good' ratings across all Core Web Vitals (Largest Contentful Paint, First Input Delay, and Cumulative Layout Shift). This is crucial for enhancing user experience, improving SEO, and demonstrating a commitment to cutting-edge web performance.

### **Current Performance Context**

Our current setup includes:

-   **SEO Performance Foundation**: Critical resource hints (preconnect, dns-prefetch, preload) and font loading optimizations (`font-display: swap`) are already in place.
-   **Automated Performance Testing**: The `testing-pipeline.yml` workflow runs Lighthouse CI, and `tests/performance/core-web-vitals.test.js` contains specific Web Vitals tests.

### **Proposed Optimization Objectives**

#### 1. **Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) - Target: <2.5s**

**Techniques:**
-   **Critical Resource Preloading**: Ensure hero images and critical CSS are preloaded with high priority.
-   **Image Optimization**: Convert images to modern formats (WebP) and implement responsive image delivery.
-   **CSS Critical Path**: Inline essential CSS for above-the-fold content and defer non-critical styles.
-   **Font Loading Strategy**: Optimize web font loading to prevent render-blocking and layout shifts.

#### 2. **First Input Delay (FID) - Target: <100ms**

**Techniques:**
-   **JavaScript Code Splitting**: Defer loading of non-critical JavaScript and implement lazy loading for interactive components.
-   **Event Listener Optimization**: Utilize passive event listeners and debounce/throttle intensive handlers.
-   **Third-party Script Management**: Load external scripts asynchronously or defer their execution.
-   **Main Thread Management**: Explore Web Workers for offloading heavy computations.

#### 3. **Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) - Target: <0.1**

**Techniques:**
-   **Dimension Reservation**: Explicitly set dimensions for images, videos, and ad slots to prevent layout shifts.
-   **Font Loading Strategy**: Use `font-display: optional` or `swap` with appropriate fallbacks to minimize text reflows.
-   **Skeleton Loading**: Implement placeholder content for dynamically loaded sections to reserve space.
-   **Animation Constraints**: Ensure animations and transitions use properties that do not trigger layout changes (e.g., `transform`, `opacity`).

### **Advanced Performance Monitoring**

We will leverage existing infrastructure and integrate real-time Web Vitals tracking:

-   **Real User Monitoring (RUM)**: Implement Web Vitals API integration (`PerformanceObserver`) to collect real-user performance data.
-   **Automated Lighthouse Audits**: Configure GitHub Actions to run Lighthouse performance audits on every deployment, asserting against the 'Good' thresholds.
-   **Performance Budget Enforcement**: Integrate performance budgets into the CI/CD pipeline to prevent regressions.

### **Acceptance Criteria**

-   [ ] **LCP**: Consistently achieves <2.5 seconds in Lighthouse and RUM data.
-   [ ] **FID**: Consistently achieves <100 milliseconds in Lighthouse and RUM data.
-   [ ] **CLS**: Consistently achieves <0.1 in Lighthouse and RUM data.
-   [ ] **Overall Performance Score**: Achieves 90+ on Lighthouse for both mobile and desktop.
-   [ ] Automated performance tests in `testing-pipeline.yml` pass with the new Core Web Vitals thresholds.
-   [ ] The website feels perceptibly faster and more fluid to users.

### **Implementation Phases**

1.  **LCP Optimization (Week 1)**: Focus on critical resource loading and image/font optimization.
2.  **FID Optimization (Week 2)**: Address JavaScript execution and third-party script impact.
3.  **CLS Prevention (Week 3)**: Implement layout stability techniques and dynamic content placeholders.
4.  **Monitoring & Automation (Ongoing)**: Integrate RUM, refine CI/CD performance gates, and establish continuous monitoring.

---

**Priority**: P1 High - Essential for professional credibility and user experience.
**Estimated Effort**: 2-3 weeks (focused implementation and validation).
**Business Value**: High - Directly impacts user engagement, SEO, and technical reputation.

### ðŸŽ¯ **Goal: Enhance Development Intelligence Dashboard with Comprehensive Quality Automation Metrics**

This issue aims to extend the existing `DevelopmentIntelligenceDashboard` to provide a more granular and real-time view of quality automation metrics. While the current dashboard offers a high-level overview, this enhancement will integrate detailed quality gate results, trend analysis, and actionable insights directly into the dashboard, transforming it into a dedicated Quality Automation Dashboard.

### **Current Dashboard Implementations**

-   **`assets/development-intelligence-dashboard.js`**: The primary dashboard implementation, providing DORA metrics, development activity, and high-level quality indicators.
-   **`.github/scripts/workflow-status-dashboard.js`**: A CLI tool for generating pipeline status and badges, which includes some performance and cost metrics.

### **Proposed Enhancements to `DevelopmentIntelligenceDashboard`**

We will enhance the `DevelopmentIntelligenceDashboard` to incorporate the following quality automation features:

#### 1. **Detailed Quality Gate Integration**

-   **Source**: Integrate data from automated quality checks (e.g., ESLint, Lighthouse, security scans, test coverage reports).
-   **Display**: Introduce new sections or expand existing ones to show pass/fail status, scores, and trends for each quality gate (e.g., Code Quality, Security, Accessibility, Performance, SEO, PWA).

#### 2. **Real-Time Quality Trend Analysis**

-   **Historical Data**: Utilize historical quality report data (e.g., from GitHub Actions artifacts or dedicated data files) to visualize trends over time.
-   **Trend Indicators**: Display clear visual indicators (e.g., up/down arrows, sparklines) for each quality metric, showing improvement or degradation.

#### 3. **Actionable Quality Insights & Alerts**

-   **Automated Insights**: Generate automated insights based on quality metric trends and thresholds (e.g., "Code quality is declining, review recent PRs").
-   **Configurable Alerts**: Implement client-side alerts or notifications for significant drops in quality scores or critical failures.

#### 4. **Drill-Down Capabilities**

-   **Report Linking**: Provide direct links from dashboard metrics to detailed quality reports (e.g., Lighthouse reports, security scan logs, test results).

### **Technical Implementation Approach**

1.  **Data Integration**: Modify `DevelopmentIntelligenceDashboard.js` to fetch and process data from various quality report sources. This may involve extending existing data loading mechanisms or adding new ones.
2.  **UI/UX Enhancements**: Update the dashboard's HTML structure and CSS (`DEVELOPMENT_INTELLIGENCE_DASHBOARD.md` provides a good blueprint) to accommodate new quality metrics and visualizations. This includes designing new cards, charts, and interactive elements.
3.  **Analytics Engine Extension**: Enhance the dashboard's internal analytics engine to calculate trends, identify anomalies, and generate insights specific to quality metrics.

### **Acceptance Criteria**

-   [ ] The `DevelopmentIntelligenceDashboard` displays real-time scores and trends for at least five key quality metrics (e.g., Code Quality, Security, Accessibility, Performance, SEO, PWA).
-   [ ] Each quality metric includes a clear trend indicator (improving, declining, stable).
-   [ ] The dashboard provides automated insights and recommendations based on quality metric performance.
-   [ ] Users can click on a quality metric to access a detailed report or log for that metric.
-   [ ] The dashboard maintains its responsiveness and performance with the added quality data.
-   [ ] The `DEVELOPMENT_INTELLIGENCE_DASHBOARD.md` documentation is updated to reflect the new quality automation features.

issue.body:
---
title: "ðŸ›¡ï¸ **P1 HIGH**: Advanced Security Excellence - Enterprise-Grade Protection Framework"
labels: "enhancement, P1: High, security, infrastructure"
---

### **ðŸŽ¯ Goal: Achieve an A+ Security Rating by Eliminating `'unsafe-inline'` in CSP**

This issue is dedicated to hardening our Content Security Policy (CSP) to achieve an A+ security rating from industry-standard tools like Mozilla Observatory. The primary objective is to remove the `'unsafe-inline'` directive from our CSP, which is currently necessary for our dynamic theme-switching functionality.

### **Current Security Implementation**

-   **Security Headers**: A robust set of security headers, including a Content Security Policy (CSP), are implemented via `<meta>` tags in `index.html`.
-   **CSP with `'unsafe-inline'`**: The current CSP allows inline scripts and styles, which is a known, though sometimes necessary, security risk.

**Current CSP:**

```html
<meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'sha256-4Rs6juvHqm2hSgLvwj1wLy0YHhR0wSBs8NW8GhXKABw=' cdn.jsdelivr.net; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' fonts.googleapis.com; font-src 'self' fonts.gstatic.com; img-src 'self' data: *.githubusercontent.com; connect-src 'self' api.github.com fonts.googleapis.com fonts.gstatic.com; frame-ancestors 'none'; base-uri 'self'; form-action 'self'; upgrade-insecure-requests">
```

### **Proposed Solution: Hash-Based CSP**

Given that we cannot use nonces (which require server-side generation) on a static platform like GitHub Pages, the best approach is to use SHA-256 hashes for our inline scripts. We will calculate the hash of our theme-switching script and add it to the `script-src` directive of our CSP.

**Proposed CSP:**

```html
<meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'sha256-THE_CALCULATED_HASH' cdn.jsdelivr.net; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' fonts.googleapis.com; font-src 'self' fonts.gstatic.com; img-src 'self' data: *.githubusercontent.com; connect-src 'self' api.github.com fonts.googleapis.com fonts.gstatic.com; frame-ancestors 'none'; base-uri 'self'; form-action 'self'; upgrade-insecure-requests">
```

*Note: The `'unsafe-inline'` for `style-src` will be addressed in a separate issue, as it is a lower-priority risk.*

### **Implementation Steps**

1.  **Calculate the SHA-256 Hash**: Calculate the hash of the inline theme-switching script.
2.  **Update the CSP**: Replace `'unsafe-inline'` in the `script-src` directive with the calculated hash.
3.  **Verify**: Use browser developer tools and online security scanners to confirm that the new CSP is working correctly and that there are no console errors.

### **Acceptance Criteria**

-   [ ] The `'unsafe-inline'` directive is removed from the `script-src` portion of the CSP in `index.html`.
-   [ ] The theme-switching functionality continues to work as expected.
-   [ ] The website achieves an A+ rating on the Mozilla Observatory.
-   [ ] There are no CSP-related errors in the browser console.
